instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>(s) and I sense
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> History liquid.

Had this board working then it stopped.
Initially changed bad value resistors on pin 28 & pin 27 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Board worked then stopped working.
Checked current sense circuit going to pin 27 & 28 again after it stopped working and resistors bad again. <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> was bad so replaced that and also replaced inrush current limmiter FET. Teted values around limmiter FET and all looks good. Turned it one, one fan spin, dead <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, bad resistors again.... What should I look for here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>(s) and I sense
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7121</CAPACITOR>/22 may be shorted/shorting, killing the resistors. 6259 should survive this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>(s) and I sense
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6193"]<CAPACITOR>C7121</CAPACITOR>/22 may be shorted/shorting, killing the resistors. 6259 should survive this. [/QUOTE]

No, no short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>(s) and I sense
threads.message: Change those caps anyway. Also change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and the 6259 of course. Make sure to check both traces to the gates of <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> pin 1 and 6. Check <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7501</RESISTOR> and associated traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> killing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>(s) and I sense
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6207"]Change those caps anyway. Also change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and the 6259 of course. Make sure to check both traces to the gates of <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> pin 1 and 6. Check <RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7501</RESISTOR> and associated traces.[/QUOTE]

Ok, so I'll go with <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> being ok but replaced it anyway... (Are pins 27 / 28 some sort of FET input differential amplifier or comparitor or something?)
Replaced inrush limiter, replaced the 10ohm resistors and checked no shorts and replaced caps and checked no shorts. PPBUS now working. No fan spin yet but will probe tomorrow.
